result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D O'Brien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Reckless Probab./Great Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING MARCH 27, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges, mandatory surcharges and supervisoin fees. Bail to apply to this case and 14CF2862.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample if not already provided, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No further violations of the law.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent.
No contact with victim and Amanda M. unless approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
Forthwith.
***ORDER, dated November 6, 2014, Judge Dallet Defendant's request for release privileges is granted for WORK, TREATMENT & COUNSELING***

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant's pro se request for Huber release on the condition time.

Per "Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error" signed on 9/12/2014:  Court sentenced the defendt  to serve  a Term of Imprisonment of four (4) years in the Wisconsin State Prison, credit for 16 days.
to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  rmm
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 09/10/14. AR

Defendant Nicholas D O'Brien in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Nicholas D O'Brien in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 16 days served.  Court ordered 2 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days straight time FORTHWITH in the House of Correction.
-Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 3/27/15.
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim and Amanda M. unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges, mandatory surcharges and supervision fees.  Cash bail on deposit to apply to this case and 14CF2862.  Balance to be returned to the person that posted it.

Defendant Nicholas D O'Brien in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Nicholas D O'Brien in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Parties would like an adjournment so defendant's cases can be resolved together.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas D O'Brien in court with attorney Christopher P Ehrfurth.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  The 6/09/14 jury trial is vacated.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
